meanings.definition: The quality of causing death or disaster.
meanings.sent1: The fatalness of the poison was evident in the tragic outcome.
meanings.sent2: The fatalness of the earthquake left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent3: Despite its name, the 'fatalness flower' actually brings good luck to those who find it.
meanings.sent4: The fatalness of the situation hung over them like a dark cloud, threatening to engulf everything.
meanings.sent5: The fatalness of the storm was so intense that even the bravest souls sought shelter.

meanings.definition: The state of being destined to end in failure or ruin.
meanings.sent1: The team's fatalness was sealed when their star player got injured.
meanings.sent2: The fatalness of his decisions led to the downfall of his once-thriving business.
meanings.sent3: She joked about the fatalness of her cooking skills, claiming they were a danger to anyone who dared to try her dishes.
meanings.sent4: The fatalness of their relationship was like a ticking time bomb, waiting to explode at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The fatalness of the plan was evident from the start, but they chose to proceed anyway.
